posts.title: Zelimir Baric aka ZELIKO
posts.content:
“ZELIMIR BARIC”Zeliko Baric, was born 1 .08. 1975 a Novi Sad, Serbia.live and working Milan  Italy.

There are examples in which I try to understand the iconic shape and the geometry that is always present in  nature.
I try to understand the characteristic of matter (in this case metal, which I consider the cosmic). It’s always a game with elements that are not perfect, to find a perfect shape you need for a new idea. The gradual implementation in order to dedicate all of the implementation of the idea. In this “battle” i can find all the elements to win. Now I feel freedom, which is the true meaning of my creation. Almost all of these items at biological and mechanical must perform the final test to oppose … and with that, be able to withstand the weight of the Creator, without any deformation. They must be durable.

wpcf-exhibition_intro: Mechanical insects come to life inside the gallery, moving from the floor to the walls.

posts.title: EMMANUELE DE RUVO
posts.content:
“PRECARIOUS EQUILIBRIA”

The art of Emmanuele De Ruvo is not, strictly speaking, performing art. As the common definition tells us, the performing arts are those forms of art which differ from the plastic arts insofar as the former uses the artist’s own body, face, and presence as a medium, and the latter uses materials such as clay, metal or paint which can be molded or transformed to create some physical art object. But there is something particular about these works, about these artistic assemblages, that makes them more than mere plastic art. On one side they act as a metaphor of ourselves and our lives; metaphors of the everlasting performance in which humanity has been involved from the start of civilisation onward. On the other side the viewers are supposed to dance carefuly around the objects, in order to preserve their fragile balance. The viewing becomes thus a breathtaking performance, leading to a higher conscience of our roles as individuals.

Eugenio Pizzorno
posts.excerpt: “PRECARIOUS EQUILIBRIA” The art of Emmanuele De Ruvo is not, strictly speaking, performing art. As the common definition tells us, the performing arts are those forms of art which differ from the plastic arts insofar as the former uses the […]

wpcf-exhibition_intro: “Who decides the system decides the dynamic, Who decides the dynamic describes the condition of life”
wpcf-artist_bio: Emmanuele De Ruvo was born in Napoli on November 28 1983. His mother is a painter and his father is an electrical engineer, who instills in him a passion for physics. Since a little boy Emmanuele shows great interest and passion for design and gets closer to painting through the world of the "Writing" and of the "Street Arts". He attends the Technical Institute with "construction building" orientation in Piedimonte Matese. Later he enrolls at the Fine Arts Academy in his hometown and graduates magna con laude. Technical studies coupled with physics and design studies will be the fundamental characteristic of his artistic path with a strong surrealist inspiration and passion for systems analysis. Particular attention is given to the studies of men and to the social and anthropological dynamics that determine its endeavors. He begins attending all the Academy exhibitions since 2005, where he distinguishes himself from the start and as a consequence is invited to attend even more important and prestigious art exhibits. Quickly and thanks to his great skills and capacities, Emmanuele arrives in Europe and then travels overseas. 2010 is the year of "Eruption Napoli/New York" at the White Box Gallery in Manhattan, an International project financed by Arcus, and the year of "Precarious Equilibriums" at the MILKandLEAD Gallery  London. He performs as an active actor in Herman Nitch "130 Aktion Naples" performance and he participates and wins at the "Italian Figurative Art" in Stockholm. In 2011 he is selected amongst the best artists graduated between the years 2000 and 2010 in the Italian Fine Arts Academies, to participate at the 54th Venice Biennale. He now is somewhere in this planet reflecting on how to keep in equilibrium the forces of life.

attachments.title: soediv 2009
attachments.description: about short film about miscalculations still life

wpcf-exhibition_intro: MILKandLEAD first opening.People arrive from outside,curious, a noise music rises from the basement of the gallery,they follow the sound,down to the spiral staircase and arrive in to a white room,where on a main wall are projected images,of 3D animation, following one another and the sounds merges on to the videos.
wpcf-artist_bio:
Vincenzo Spagnuolo was born 9 october 1984
He graduated in Set Design at the Academy of Fine Arts Naples
Since 2005 he began his research on the possibilities of graphics and stylistic
new technologies to achieve his ideas,studies and software to benefit from,the knowledge of the composition and modeling in 3D animation, which combines the traditional studies on the animation to the formation
in stage design and directing. 
Creates a very personal and artistic journey from pioneering
order to provide a visual quality that deviates from the representation or virtual  simulacrum using only the power of technology to reach a graphic balance between diagram and representation.

The first DVD pre temporal order of creation: Soediv began in 1999 where experiments alternatives to the use of hyper-realistic computer graphics ever revealing propensity toward music video.

The second DVD: Short film about miscalculations shows how the path has reached the limit of instinctivity becoming only the diagram in the abstract virtual. In fact all the videos of this collection were not created by the artist but simply collected, the videos are whether created accidentally by errors of calculation of the machine during rendering or shooting with digital cameras. There is no control in these videos by the artist who becomes only a research left to chance and the creative capacity of the machine.
Observing the DNA of the machine, receiving the error as changes or new combination and keeps the result as it evolved spontaneously.

The third DVD contains 3 courses and an outside series:
Still Life is the return of language in search of wild and instinctive awareness
applied to the bases of the new meaning of virtual representation as primitive pictures.
Landscape grammar applies to the construction of new exterior and interior in order to create a child of this universe stylistic research.
Icons applys the grammar to the figures, portraits and icons.
Tie the signifier to the signified.
The characters portrayed are: Obama, Nixon, Berlusconi, Gaddafi, Che Guevara, Fidel Castro, Hitler
out of series: These are 3 exclusive video from the series as it does not find a place clear within the course and made almost a synthesis that excludes the rest.In this case are set out in the series and also the viewer is conscious of
the difference between these videos and the balance (if there is any).
